revised_title: The Decomposition of Corrosive Sublimate and Its Reactions with Various Substances
tldr: The author investigates the decomposition of corrosive sublimate and its reactions with various substances, including muriatic acid, ammonia salts, and oils. The experiments reveal that light alone cannot decompose corrosive sublimate, and that it requires the aid of other affinities. The author also discovers new compounds and reactions between corrosive sublimate and other substances.
